args:
Beren is using his ability to control black mana
to make Elysium bend to his will, which is why
the Five Greatwyrms are unable to use their
primal powers. Knowing this, the party faces off
against the Holywyrm to free him from his
suffering and regain the abilities they seek.
If you don't stand against Xenos, there\nwill be no possibility left in the world!\nThat can't be what you want!
Let me pose a question to you:\nWhy does it matter if possibility exists?
Success. Failure. Victory. Annihilation.\nOne never knows which side they will\nfind themselves on until the very end.
None knows what possibility awaits them\nin the future yet to come.
So why do you cling so tenaciously to the\nbelief that there is even possibility at all?
For all you know, you may well be heading\nstraight for a fixed conclusion completely\nregardless of the Progenitor.
Besides, even if there IS possibility,\nthere can be only one result in the end.
So how, then? How can you care so much\nabout something so utterly pointless?
You may not be able to understand this,\nbut having no possibilities is actually quite\nfreeing.
You're right, Beren: I don't understand that\nand I never will! How in the world could a\nlack of possibility EVER be a good thing?!
Enough. Our time would be better spent\narguing with a stone wall. Let us force\nhis capitulation and be done with it.
I'm glad at least one of you understands.\nNow why don't I give you all a reward?
Aaah ha ha! Oh, what an honor it will be\nto fall to the very Holywyrm you so revere!
Beren has shrouded the Holywyrm in black\nmana and forced him to do his bidding.
I realize now why you are unable to regain\nyour primal powers, my descendant.
Can you not feel it? Wind, fire, water,\nlight, and shadow—all of our primordial\npowers now emanate from the Holywyrm.
I DO sense that! But why?!
You have not lost your powers. Rather,\nthey have become the elements and\ndrifted across the world once more.
When you awaken to your powers, it is\nnormally an easy thing to regain them.
But while you were unaware, someone\nbegan to control the elements themselves.
Ooo, that really burns my britches!\nWho does he think he is, snatching our\npowers from us like that?!
He likely did so in an attempt to face\nthe Progenitor on his own.

I surmise he attempted to gather the
primordial elements as we once did
so he might offer his own body as a
vessel for the Origin.
Or perhaps he sought to bypass the Origin\nentirely and gain the power to remove the\nProgenitor on his own.
Okay, I know I'm like 40 steps behind\neverybody here, but I thought Elysium\nwas trying to REVIVE the Progenitor!
That's right! Elysium wanted nothing\nto do with possibility OR the Origin!
It is true the Holywyrm lost hope in\npossibility, but that did not mean he was\nwilling to let the Progenitor hold sway.
He would have been aware that a world\nruled by the Progenitor would have ill\neffects on the living creatures within it.
Thus, he must have believed he would\nrequire enough power to eliminate the\nProgenitor himself.
And perhaps he hoped to control the world\neven after the Progenitor had removed all\npossibility from it.
Okay, but that's bonkers, right? I mean,\n'cause it sounds COMPLETELY bonkers.
He did it out of love.
Elysium loved this world and every\nlast thing in it.
To him, we're creatures in need of\nprotection. He even thought of dragons\nthat way.
That's why he didn't ask for help or push\nthe responsibility onto anyone else.\nIt was a burden he had to carry alone.

It's not like there was any other being on
his level. Maybe things would have been
different if the original Five Greatwyrms
had still been kicking around.
Poor guy was all alone with no one\nelse to help him...
I don't remember anything from before I\nwas reborn, yet I still feel somehow\nresponsible for the situation.

The Holywyrm had always been overly
sympathetic; he was deeply saddened
by our decision to become the vessel
for the Origin, as well.
I find it extremely likely that he sought\nyour powers so no other being would\never have to be sacrificed again.
So in the end, our combined primal\npowers have taken form...in him.
Well, that is just a DELIGHTFUL story.\nIt's the ultimate ending of possibility!
Believing in their own possibility, everyone\nchooses the path they think is best.
But look what happened! Elysium tried to\neliminate the Progenitor and ended up\nas his puppet!
And that's why you don't have the power\nto stand against him!
Oh, and who was it that caused all this to\nhappen in the first place? YOU did, when\nyou decided to fight Elysium!
You fought so hard in the name of\npossibility, and now it's your fault\nthat possibility is dead!
Oh, but this is high comedy indeed—\nand a tale that perfectly demonstrates\nhow pointless your love of possibility is!
You might be right...if this was the end.
But this isn't the end, and there are still\nplenty of possibilities waiting for us!

Elysium's methods may have been
misguided, but as the Auspex who once
worshipped him, I shall prove his love
was ever true and righteous!

And here I thought you could not get any
more annoying.... Ah, but no matter.
Your fate is set in stone no matter how
you may squawk and kick.
Now go, Elysium! Know the pleasure of\nkilling the creatures you once loved so!
I have a request for you, my descendants:\nfree the Holywyrm from his suffering.
You wish us to slay Elysium?!
Would that I could do it myself. But it is\nimpossible as I am now, so I must pass\nthe task to the Greatwyrms of today.
However, in doing so, you will accomplish\nwhat you came here to do.
So once we've defeated the Holywyrm,\nour powers will be returned to us?
Getting my powers back will be nice,\nbut I'm more worried about stopping\nElysium's pain.
The Holywyrm is custodian of the world\nand lord of all wyrms. We cannot permit\nhim to be violated any longer.
Now! For the pride of all dragons!
